title: Zechariah Chapter 5 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Zechariah chapter 5 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Zechariah Chapter 5 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Zechariah Chapter 5.

questions.question: What did Zechariah see when he lifted up his eyes in Zechariah 5:1?
questions.correctAnswer: A flying roll
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:1 states he looked and saw a flying roll.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 5:2, what were the dimensions of the flying roll?
options: Twenty cubits long and ten cubits wide
Ten cubits long and five cubits wide
Thirty cubits long and fifteen cubits wide
Fifteen cubits long and seven cubits wide
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty cubits long and ten cubits wide
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:2 describes the flying roll as twenty cubits long and ten cubits wide.

questions.question: What is the curse described in Zechariah 5:3 associated with?
questions.correctAnswer: Stealing and swearing falsely
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:3 explains the curse goes forth on everyone who steals or swears falsely.

questions.question: Where will the curse enter according to Zechariah 5:4?
options: The house of the thief and the one who swears falsely
questions.correctAnswer: The house of the thief and the one who swears falsely
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:4 states the curse will enter the house of the thief and the house of him who swears falsely.

questions.question: What did the angel tell Zechariah to lift up his eyes to see in Zechariah 5:5?
questions.correctAnswer: What is going forth
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:5 says the angel told him to lift his eyes and see what is going forth.

questions.question: What object is described as going forth in Zechariah 5:6?
questions.correctAnswer: An ephah
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:6 describes the object going forth as an ephah.

questions.question: In Zechariah 5:7, what was found sitting in the midst of the ephah?
questions.correctAnswer: A woman
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:7 says a woman was sitting in the midst of the ephah.

questions.question: What did the talent of lead represent in Zechariah 5:8?
questions.correctAnswer: Wickedness
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:8 states the talent of lead represents wickedness.

questions.question: How many women came out with wings like a stork, according to Zechariah 5:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Two
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:9 describes two women with wings like storks.

questions.question: Where were the two women carrying the ephah according to Zechariah 5:11?
options: To build it a house in the land of Shinar
questions.correctAnswer: To build it a house in the land of Shinar
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:11 states the ephah is taken to build a house in the land of Shinar.

questions.question: True or False: The flying roll mentioned in Zechariah 5:1 is described as being very small.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:2 describes the flying roll as twenty cubits by ten cubits, which is large, so it is not small.

questions.question: True or False: According to Zechariah 5:3, the curse will not affect those who steal.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:3 clearly says the curse goes on everyone who steals, so it does affect them.

questions.question: True or False: The two women that came out to carry the ephah had wings like eagles according to Zechariah 5:9.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:9 states the women had wings like storks, not eagles.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Zechariah 5:4: 'I will bring it forth, saith the LORD of hosts, and it shall enter into the house of the ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: thief
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:4 states the curse will enter the house of the thief.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Zechariah 5:7: 'And, behold, there was lifted up a talent of ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: lead
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:7 mentions a talent of lead was lifted up.

medium.title: Zechariah Chapter 5 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Zechariah Chapter 5 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with honesty at work. Based on Zechariah 5:1-4, what biblical truth would you share about integrity?
options: Dishonesty brings a curse that affects one’s whole household
Stealing is acceptable if no one is watching
Swearing falsely is a small offense
questions.correctAnswer: Dishonesty brings a curse that affects one’s whole household
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:3-4 teaches that stealing and swearing falsely bring a curse that will consume the thief’s house, emphasizing the serious consequences of dishonesty.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 5:3-4 encourage believers to trust in God's justice when facing trials related to others’ dishonesty?
options: God will bring judgment on the dishonest, even if it takes time
God ignores the dishonest and focuses on the faithful
Dishonest acts will always go unpunished
questions.correctAnswer: God will bring judgment on the dishonest, even if it takes time
questions.explanation: Verses 3-4 show God’s promise to bring forth the curse on thieves and false swearers, encouraging believers to trust in His righteous judgment.

questions.question: A church member struggles with prayer discipline. How does the vision of the flying roll in Zechariah 5:1-2 inspire faith and obedience in spiritual disciplines?
options: Obedience to God’s commands is as broad and long as the flying roll, covering all our life
Spiritual discipline is optional and not important
God only cares about large acts of faith
Prayer is meaningless if not public
questions.correctAnswer: Obedience to God’s commands is as broad and long as the flying roll, covering all our life
questions.explanation: The flying roll's large size (twenty by ten cubits) in verses 1-2 symbolizes the extensive reach of God's law, reminding believers to fully commit to obedience and discipline.

questions.question: What lesson about honesty and speech can we learn from Zechariah 5:3 regarding daily life?
options: Both stealing and false swearing bring severe consequences
Only stealing is condemned, not speech
Swearing falsely is allowed under pressure
Honesty is only required in public settings
questions.correctAnswer: Both stealing and false swearing bring severe consequences
questions.explanation: Verse 3 clearly states that stealing and swearing falsely both cause a curse, teaching the importance of integrity in actions and words.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 5:4 show God’s power to discipline and purify a family or household affected by sin?
options: God will consume the house of the thief and false swearer to remove sin
God ignores family sins and focuses on individuals only
Sin does not affect anyone beyond the sinner
Punishment is always delayed and indirect
questions.correctAnswer: God will consume the house of the thief and false swearer to remove sin
questions.explanation: Verse 4 depicts God bringing the curse into the house of the sinner, consuming it with timber and stones, illustrating the thoroughness of divine discipline.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to compromise integrity for gain. How does the vision of the woman called 'wickedness' in Zechariah 5:6-8 warn us about sin?
options: Wickedness is confined and weighed down, but present in the world
Wickedness is easy to ignore without consequences
Wickedness is to be embraced as part of life
questions.correctAnswer: Wickedness is confined and weighed down, but present in the world
questions.explanation: Verses 7-8 illustrate wickedness as a woman inside an ephah with a lead weight on her mouth, symbolizing sin being contained but still existing, warning believers to resist temptation.

questions.question: What does Zechariah 5:9-11 teach about God’s sovereignty over evil and temptation in our lives?
options: God will remove wickedness from the land by establishing it far away
Evil will always rule in the believer’s life
Temptation should be welcomed as a test
God allows wickedness to remain without limit
questions.correctAnswer: God will remove wickedness from the land by establishing it far away
questions.explanation: Verses 9-11 describe two women carrying the ephah with wickedness to Shinar to establish it there, showing God’s control and removal of evil from His people’s midst.

questions.question: How can Zechariah 5:5-6 encourage believers to lift their eyes and focus on God’s promises during difficult times?
options: Lifting up eyes symbolizes hopeful trust in God’s unfolding plan
Looking away from God is the best response
Focusing on troubles only increases fear
God’s promises are hidden and unreachable
questions.correctAnswer: Lifting up eyes symbolizes hopeful trust in God’s unfolding plan
questions.explanation: Verse 5 encourages lifting eyes to see what is going forth, symbolizing faith and attention to God’s active work even amid hardship.

questions.question: True or False: According to Zechariah 5:3-4, God’s curse upon thieves and false swearers is limited only to their personal punishment and does not affect their households.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:4 explains that the curse will enter the house of the thief and false swearer and consume it with timber and stones, showing the impact on their household.

questions.question: True or False: The flying roll in Zechariah 5:1-2 is described as being twenty cubits long and ten cubits wide.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 2 explicitly states the flying roll's length as twenty cubits and the breadth as ten cubits, emphasizing its large size.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: In Zechariah 5:7, a talent of _____ was lifted up, representing a woman sitting in the ephah.
questions.correctAnswer: lead
questions.explanation: Verse 7 describes a talent of lead lifted up which is symbolic of the woman representing wickedness inside the ephah.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 5:8 teach believers about the power of sin and the need for restraint?
options: Wickedness is restrained by a heavy weight, showing sin’s burden
Sin is light and can be ignored
Wickedness is free to roam without consequence
Sin has no effect on a believer’s life
questions.correctAnswer: Wickedness is restrained by a heavy weight, showing sin’s burden
questions.explanation: Verse 8 shows the lead weight cast upon the mouth of wickedness, symbolizing restraint and the heavy burden sin brings, urging believers to resist it.

questions.question: A fellow believer is discouraged by temptation. Based on Zechariah 5:9, what encouragement can you offer about God’s care in spiritual battles?
options: God actively removes wickedness by supernatural means
Believers are left alone to fight sin
Wickedness has no beginning or end
questions.correctAnswer: God actively removes wickedness by supernatural means
questions.explanation: Verse 9 describes two women with wings lifting the ephah containing wickedness, symbolizing God’s active intervention to remove evil.

questions.question: What practical lesson about stewardship and accountability does Zechariah 5:3-4 provide for Christian living?
options: Honest living protects not only oneself but also one’s household from destruction
Stealing is a minor issue in stewardship
Accountability only applies to church leaders
questions.correctAnswer: Honest living protects not only oneself but also one’s household from destruction
questions.explanation: The curse consuming the thief’s house in verses 3-4 teaches that integrity safeguards one’s family and possessions, promoting faithful stewardship.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 5:11 show God’s plan for the final removal of wickedness?
options: Wickedness will be established in the land of Shinar, separated from God’s people
Wickedness will remain within the community
questions.correctAnswer: Wickedness will be established in the land of Shinar, separated from God’s people
questions.explanation: Verse 11 states the ephah with wickedness is taken to Shinar to build a house for it, symbolizing God’s removal and separation of sin from His people.

hard.title: Zechariah Chapter 5 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Zechariah Chapter 5.

questions.question: What is the length and breadth of the flying roll that Zechariah sees?
questions.correctAnswer: 20 cubits long and 10 cubits wide
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:2 describes the flying roll as being twenty cubits in length and ten cubits in breadth.

questions.question: What does the flying roll symbolize according to the angel's explanation?
options: A curse going forth over the whole earth
questions.correctAnswer: A curse going forth over the whole earth
questions.explanation: In Zechariah 5:3, the angel explains that the flying roll is the curse that goes over the face of the whole earth.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The curse on the flying roll will consume the house of the thief and the one who ______ falsely by God's name.
questions.correctAnswer: swears
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:4 states that the curse will enter into the house of him that swears falsely by God's name and consume it.

questions.question: What object does Zechariah see going forth after the flying roll?
questions.correctAnswer: An ephah
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:6 reveals that the next object going forth is an ephah, a measuring basket.

questions.question: The woman sitting in the midst of the ephah is identified as what?
questions.correctAnswer: Wickedness
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:8 identifies the woman in the ephah as wickedness.

questions.question: What is placed upon the mouth of the ephah containing the woman?
questions.correctAnswer: A weight of lead
questions.explanation: According to Zechariah 5:8, a weight of lead is cast upon the mouth of the ephah to seal it.

questions.question: The two women that come with wings like a stork carry the ephah between which two realms?
questions.correctAnswer: Between earth and heaven
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:9 describes the two women bearing the ephah between the earth and the heaven.

questions.question: True or False: The woman inside the ephah represents righteousness and justice.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:8 explicitly states the woman represents wickedness, not righteousness.

questions.question: Where do the two winged women carry the ephah to build a house?
questions.correctAnswer: The land of Shinar
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:11 states that the ephah is taken to the land of Shinar to build a house for it.

questions.question: What is the significance of the curse flying over the whole earth in the context of ancient Near Eastern covenant curses?
options: It reflects universal judgment for covenant breach
It denotes a blessing for all nations
It foreshadows the destruction of the temple
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects universal judgment for covenant breach
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:3-4 echoes covenant curses found in Deuteronomy where theft and false swearing lead to universal judgment, signaling God's justice over all earth.

questions.question: The ephah as a measuring basket in Zechariah 5:6-7 can be understood typologically as representing what theme found elsewhere in Scripture?
questions.correctAnswer: Judgment and measurement of sin
questions.explanation: The ephah, a standard measure, symbolizes God's judgment in measuring wickedness, similar to its use in Amos 8:5-6 as a symbol of injustice.

questions.question: The imagery of the flying roll in Zechariah 5:1-4 is an example of what literary device common in prophetic literature?
questions.correctAnswer: Symbolic vision
questions.explanation: The flying roll is a symbolic vision used by the prophet to communicate divine judgment in a vivid and memorable way.

questions.question: The land of Shinar mentioned in Zechariah 5:11 historically corresponds to which ancient region?
questions.correctAnswer: Mesopotamia
questions.explanation: Shinar is an ancient term for the southern Mesopotamian plain, often associated with Babylon.

questions.question: What does the weight of lead sealing the ephah's mouth symbolize in the context of ancient Near Eastern customs?
questions.correctAnswer: Containment of wickedness
questions.explanation: Sealing with lead indicates containment or imprisonment, here symbolizing the binding and restraint of wickedness within the ephah.

questions.question: How does the theme of false swearing in Zechariah 5:3-4 connect to the broader biblical concern with truthfulness?
options: It underscores the covenantal importance of honesty
It ignores the significance of speech
questions.correctAnswer: It underscores the covenantal importance of honesty
questions.explanation: The curse on false swearing reflects the biblical emphasis on truthfulness as foundational to covenant faithfulness (cf. Exodus 20:16).

theological.title: Zechariah Chapter 5 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Zechariah Chapter 5 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What is the symbolic significance of the flying roll in Zechariah 5?
options: It represents the curse that goes forth over the whole earth
It symbolizes the covenant of peace from God
It depicts the Messiah's coming reign
It is a sign of Israel's restoration
questions.correctAnswer: It represents the curse that goes forth over the whole earth
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:3 explains that the flying roll is the curse that goes forth over the whole earth, judging theft and false swearing. This imagery aligns with the biblical theme of divine judgment on sin (cf. Deuteronomy 27:26; Galatians 3:10; Revelation 22:18-19; Jeremiah 17:1).

questions.question: According to Zechariah 5, what two sins are specifically judged by the flying roll?
questions.correctAnswer: Stealing and false swearing
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:3 states that everyone who steals or swears falsely will be cut off, showing God's judgment against both theft and perjury. This reflects God's holiness and justice (Exodus 20:16; Proverbs 6:16-19; Matthew 5:33-37; James 5:12).

questions.question: What does the ephah represent in the vision described in Zechariah 5?
options: The measure of wickedness throughout the earth
The purity of the temple worship
questions.correctAnswer: The measure of wickedness throughout the earth
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:6 says the ephah that goes forth is their resemblance through all the earth, symbolizing the spread of wickedness. This fits with biblical metaphors of measurement representing God's judgment on sin (cf. Ezekiel 4:1-5; Amos 8:1-2; Revelation 6:1-8; Proverbs 16:11).

questions.question: In Zechariah 5, what is the identity of the woman sitting inside the ephah?
questions.correctAnswer: Wickedness
questions.explanation: Verse 8 identifies the woman as wickedness, sealed inside the ephah with a lead weight, indicating containment of sin and corruption. This imagery echoes the biblical theme of sin personified (Proverbs 7:21-23; Romans 7:17-20; 2 Corinthians 11:3; Revelation 17:1-6).

questions.question: What is the purpose of the lead weight placed on the ephah in Zechariah 5?
options: To seal in wickedness and prevent it from escaping
To symbolize God's grace covering sin
To measure the abundance of the harvest
questions.correctAnswer: To seal in wickedness and prevent it from escaping
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:8 describes the weight of lead cast upon the mouth of the ephah, symbolizing the containment and judgment of wickedness. This reflects God's sovereign control over sin and evil (Isaiah 24:21-22; Nahum 1:9; Revelation 20:1-3; Psalm 7:11-13).

questions.question: What creatures are described as carrying the ephah in Zechariah 5, and what is their significance?
options: Two women with wings like a stork, symbolizing swift removal of wickedness
Two angels with trumpets, heralding judgment
Two lions with wings, representing strength and authority
Two eagles soaring, denoting divine protection
questions.correctAnswer: Two women with wings like a stork, symbolizing swift removal of wickedness
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:9 describes two women with stork-like wings lifting the ephah, which likely symbolizes the swift and certain removal of iniquity from the land. This connects with biblical motifs of winged creatures as agents of God’s judgment or deliverance (Exodus 19:4; Psalm 91:4; Jeremiah 8:7; Revelation 12:14).

questions.question: To which location are the two winged women carrying the ephah in Zechariah 5?
questions.correctAnswer: The land of Shinar
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:11 states that the ephah is carried to the land of Shinar, the ancient name associated with Babylon, symbolizing a place of exile and judgment. This fits the biblical narrative where Babylon represents opposition to God’s people and a place of divine discipline (Genesis 11:2; Daniel 1:1; Isaiah 13:19; Revelation 18:2).

questions.question: What does the flying roll’s dimensions (twenty cubits by ten cubits) in Zechariah 5 symbolize?
options: The comprehensive scope of God's judgment
The size of the temple altar
The height of the Messiah’s coming kingdom
The measure of Israel's covenant blessings
questions.correctAnswer: The comprehensive scope of God's judgment
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:2 gives the dimensions of the flying roll, emphasizing the large and imposing nature of the judgment that covers the whole earth. This aligns with biblical themes of God’s universal justice (Psalm 19:1; Isaiah 40:22; Jeremiah 23:24; Romans 3:19).

questions.question: What ultimate effect does God declare the curse will have on the houses of thieves and false swearers in Zechariah 5?
options: It will consume the house with timber and stones
It will bless the house with prosperity
It will protect the house from enemies
It will grant the house peace and safety
questions.correctAnswer: It will consume the house with timber and stones
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:4 explains that the curse will enter the house of the thief or false swearer and consume it with its timber and stones, symbolizing total destruction due to sin. This is consistent with Old Testament judgments against sin (Deuteronomy 28:30; Proverbs 1:7-19; Ezekiel 13:9; Malachi 4:1).

questions.question: Who instructs Zechariah to lift his eyes and observe the visions in chapter 5?
options: The angel that talked with him
questions.correctAnswer: The angel that talked with him
questions.explanation: Verses 5 and 10 show the angel speaking to Zechariah and instructing him to lift his eyes and observe the visions. Angels as God's messengers revealing divine mysteries are common in Scripture (Daniel 8:16; Luke 1:19; Revelation 1:1; Hebrews 1:14).

questions.question: What theological doctrine is illustrated by the flying roll's curse going forth over the whole earth in Zechariah 5?
options: The doctrine of universal sin and judgment
questions.correctAnswer: The doctrine of universal sin and judgment
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:3 shows the curse going forth over all the earth, reflecting the biblical truth that sin affects all humanity and that God's righteous judgment is universal (Romans 3:23; Ecclesiastes 12:14; Hebrews 9:27; John 3:18).

questions.question: How does the imagery of the woman representing wickedness in Zechariah 5 relate to the biblical theme of sin personification?
options: It personifies sin as an active, corrupting force
It represents the Spirit of God dwelling in believers
It depicts wisdom guiding the people
questions.correctAnswer: It personifies sin as an active, corrupting force
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:7-8 portrays wickedness as a woman in the ephah, a vivid personification of sin's pervasive and destructive nature. This aligns with biblical depictions of sin as a power that enslaves and deceives (Romans 7:14-25; James 1:14-15; Proverbs 5:3-6; Revelation 17:1-6).

questions.question: What does Zechariah 5 teach about God's response to sin in the context of covenant faithfulness?
options: God actively judges sin to uphold His holiness and covenant
God ignores sin to maintain peace
God rewards sin to test faith
God abolishes the covenant because of sin
questions.correctAnswer: God actively judges sin to uphold His holiness and covenant
questions.explanation: The chapter shows God's proactive judgment on stealing and false swearing (Zechariah 5:3-4), emphasizing His holiness and faithfulness to the covenant. This is consistent with God's character throughout Scripture (Leviticus 19:11; Psalm 89:34; Hebrews 10:26-31; 1 Peter 1:15-16).

questions.question: What eschatological theme can be derived from the vision of removing wickedness to the land of Shinar in Zechariah 5?
options: The final removal of sin from God's people
The permanent reign of Babylon over Israel
The eternal blessing of the wicked
questions.correctAnswer: The final removal of sin from God's people
questions.explanation: Zechariah 5:11 describes the wickedness being set in Shinar, symbolizing the removal of sin from the holy community. This foreshadows the eschatological hope of sin's ultimate banishment (Revelation 21:27; Isaiah 65:17; Ezekiel 36:25-27; Romans 8:21).

questions.question: How does the flying roll vision in Zechariah 5 affirm God's attribute of justice?
options: It shows God executing righteous judgment on sin
It demonstrates God's mercy overriding justice
It reveals God's indifference to sin
It illustrates God's acceptance of all behaviors
questions.correctAnswer: It shows God executing righteous judgment on sin
questions.explanation: The flying roll carrying a curse that affects thieves and false swearers (Zechariah 5:3-4) highlights God's justice—He does not tolerate sin but judges it righteously (Psalm 89:14; Isaiah 30:18; Romans 2:5-11; Revelation 19:11).
